meanings.definition: To breathe in air or another substance
meanings.sent1: She inhaled deeply before blowing out the candles on her birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: The hiker inhaled the fresh mountain air as he reached the summit.
meanings.sent3: The puppy inhaled its food so quickly that it almost choked.
meanings.sent4: As the music filled the room, she inhaled the melody like a sweet perfume.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies in the kitchen made her inhale deeply, savoring every scent.

meanings.sent1: After the race, she inhaled a refreshing glass of water.
meanings.sent2: He inhaled the delicious aroma of the freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent3: The students inhaled their lunch in record time, eager to get back to playing.
meanings.sent4: The artist inhaled the beauty of the sunset, capturing it in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The garden was so fragrant that she inhaled deeply, taking in all the floral scents around her.
